The port to mobile is almost perfect. The only issue I have seen (and as some other people pointed out) is that it is a little easy to select the wrong card to play. But this issue isn't a big deal if you are aware and careful. Slay the Spire is a great game and one that I have played for dozens of hours across a number of platforms. I would definitely recommend it.

column3: Great card game with lots of replay value. Loved it on the PC and was glad to see it on mobile.

Slay the Spire is a turn based card game. I enjoy that it gives you a challenge. There's a lot of variety which gives it replay value. I would describe the game as a rogue like where each run is unique. This game falls short on some gameplay mechanics; enemies continuously get stronger after each turn while you get weaker which just ends up feeling frustrating and unfair rather than fun
column4: making it overall an unsatisfying game to play. Controls are also finicky. Hard "maybe" for recommendation.

The game is great fun. The android port is unstable with crashes and losing data. If you play through an entire run it will likely be fine. If you do a run and try to come back to it the run will likely be deleted. Unfortunate for such a great game.

column3: There are some slight issues with card selection when you have a massive hand
column4: but I imagine it's less problematic if playing on a tablet due to more screen size. Overall
column5: I'd say it's a really good port
column6: my biggest issue is properly selecting things on the top bar
column7: but that could be due to my fat fingers. Pro tip
column8: if you're trying to deselect a card
column9: drag it down to one of the bottom corners of the screen
column10: this will take the "cursor" off of the cards and nothing will be selected.

Pros Its a good game Cons Successful start-up~50% of the time Constantly asks you to pair with a mobile profile Sometimes clicking cards and letting go will keep that card 'held' so you have to slowly click out of the 'held' card to choose another card The card is displayed too small and is hard to select Unlike on PC
column4: you cant see card upgrades through rightclick Overall the cons ruin the game experience. The controls/UI were not designed for mobile and the experience suffers as a result.

column3: 2 big issues I have with this otherwise great game. 1.) The inability to look at the upgrades of cards unless they are in your deck. It's in the pc version and definitely needs to be here. 2.) Stop making the game remember what card I touched last. The amount of times I try to put a card back in my hand instead of playing it only for the game to decide that I have to play it anyway is infuriating and honestly kinda game breaking (cant safely check actual dmg). Plz fix these and itll be perfect.

Not worth it on Android. The game is full of bugs. Sometimes you finish the run and the game doesn't save. At the beginning of the game if you have internet the game gets stuck syncing forever. Sometimes you select a card and the game makes it very hard to deselect and you end up playing the wrong card. Very bad experience for the price

column3: It's the best game

My favorite Android game. I've played 100's at this point and this is the one. Highly recommend. Deep character strategy and daily climbs provide 100+hrs of entertainment. Great Game. 1 note to the devs: recently I've noticed that the unlocks aren't syncing right. I've had to re-install a number of times and I can't unlock the full deck. At the end of a run I don't see any progress towards the character unlocks
column4: but then I look in the compendium and I see I have more unlocks for that character.

column3: There is currently a bug in the game where your current run can be lost after choosing save&quit and closing the app (or even simply changing apps).
Slay the Spire is a fantastic game
column4: and this is generally a great port. The only major issue I have is that on winning or losing a run
column5: the app freezes for a while
column6: presumably because it's submitting the run to cloud servers. It'd be nice to either have a way to turn cloud saves off
column7: or to submit the runs asynchronously without blocking the main game. Still a very (re)playable and enjoyable game
column8: will update review if that issue gets fixed.

column3: The game is great
column4: but the whole reason I got the mobile app was because I wanted to be able to pick it up and play as I go. Everytime I play a game though
column5: if I want to save and leave that run where it is
column6: next time I play the game won't have saved correctly
column7: and my run is gone. No record of it. Sometimes it even puts me back midway through previous run that day that I already finished. The saving just doesn't work.

column3: This is a 5 star game
column4: but with some frustrating bugs. I've been playing for two months and I've just realised that some cards stay locked and do not appear ingame even though I've fully leveled up all the characters. This does not happen in the PC version. Hoping for an update in the future that will fix this issue as some of the locked cards are extremely important in higher ascensions.

column3: This version of the app is a disaster. Honestly
column4: I've lost so many good runs due to the terrible UI. Many other people have already mentioned the flaws
column5: so I'll not bother listing them all here. I would expect for the price of this game there would have been some actual work put into making a good android version
column6: but it's clear it's just been directly ported over from the PC version with nothing done to make it a true mobile app. Very disappointing. If you're going to bother spending the money
column7: I'd pick up the PC version. You'll save yourself a lot frustration when it again chooses the wrong card for you. The game is 5 stars
column8: the app is 2 I'm afraid.

column3: Favorite game turned Early Access. I've played over 400 hrs on the computer. I love it and the game literally brought roguelite card builders onto the front page. However
column4: this port to my phone feels like an early access game. The buttons are too small and the touchscreen/hit boxes seem really off. The worst
column5: however
column6: is the game's random non-saving. Not only does it NOT SAVE AT EVERY STAGE like regular Slay
column7: it frequently doesnt save anything at all.

column3: The game is great on Steam
column4: but the memory management in this version is absolute garbage. It will just forget that you were in the middle of a run. And despite it syncing data all the time
column5: you lose all progress if you uninstall and reinstall. Games have had this figured out for years. Not sure why a super successful game can't get it right.

column3: It's great to have slay the spire on mobile. That being said
column4: the incredibly slow syncing and the tendency of this version to lose save files can make this a frustrating experience. As everyone else stated
column4: the UI is awful. It doesn't event take into account displays which might have on-screen notchs
column5: make some items unclickable (I can't even see what on my draw pile???). Worse
column6: there's no way to rotate the screen to make them clickable in any way. The other annoying
column7: chronic illness is the boot up time. I know other users are having trouble with endless and continuous "syncing data" message throughout the game
column8: but mine only appears on boot up. It takes the game more than a whole minute to load
column9: what the heck? Devs
column10: if you can contact me I'd love to work alongside you to help you fix these issues. Sadly
column11: and since no more updates have been issues since APRIL
column12: it looks like they sent the thing into the store and decided not to spend a any more time on its development.

column3: Slay the spire is an incredible game and I would recommend it to anyone who likes deckbuilders
column4: roguelikes
column5: or really just anyone who likes good games. This implementation is mostly fine with exactly one flaw - tapping on and casting cards is very clunky. Somethng about the touch detection is off. With a simple fix this would be a perfect game
column6: but right now it's a big enough flaw that I need to dock a star. Please fix clicking on cards in your hand.

column3: PC Game is great but this is just a mess. Sync Issues overwrite saves
column4: so I lose progress on ongoing runs all the time. There are no options for sync or google play
column5: let alone the possibility to manually choose a save location. Changing languages seems to mess with sync also. UI controls are also not good. It's very hard to deselect a card and easy to accidentally play the wrong one. Controls are often clunky. It's like you can still feel the leftovers of PCs mouse control working against you.

column3: I love this game & I've wasted 100s of hours playing it
column4: but the Android version is unreliable because saving is so hit & miss. When I try to resume a saved game
column5: it's a crapshoot. Sometimes I load in with no issue
column6: but a good majority of the time I either load in to an old file with lost progress
column7: load into a whole different file (sometimes not even the same character)
column8: or there's no data to load & I have to start a new run. It's very frustrating constantly losing progress and starting over.

column3: This game is one of the hardest card games I've ever played everything is this game is by chance. Don't build towards anything specific build to fill every need and be open to repeating yourself the replay-ability of this game is amazing and it is well worth the challenge. It took me 38 hours to get my first win with over 99 loses that on my 100th game I won. Determination and well thought out synergy is key to victory. 10/10

column5: but the abysmal controls make this a terrible port

This is basically a rogue-like which takes a lot of influence from board games like Dominion. All the decks are well balanced and the difficulty curve
column4: while steep
column5: is almost never unfair. As is the case with most card games
column6: sometimes you might just have bad draw after bad draw and the loss might feel cheap but that's just the nature of all such games. The artwork is beautiful and the cards' special effects are also well done. One negative - The game has inconsistent touch recognition.

column3: The same great game play found on other platforms. However
column4: there are a few issues. 1. The syncing takes way too long upon launch. Then what's with the constant pulsing of text in the top right corner. 2. Selecting cards can be irritating. Deselecting after you let go of the card would help. 3. My scores on the daily challenge aren't being added to the leader board. Great to have a portable version of one of my favorite games
column5: but could still use some updates.

column3: One of the actual best games I've ever played and it's on my phone (?!). I had over 600 hours with this on the Switch and now have a similar amount on Android. That's an insane amount of quality
column4: engaging
column5: varied gameplay for such a small amount. Megacrit have created the definitive deckbuilding roguelike here. It simply cannot be beaten (literally if you're playing for a heart kill at A20 with the Silent).

column3: A great game
column4: a not so great port. It's quick to get used to the horrible touch recognition but it's always present. You have to actively work against the game so that you don't cast a wrong card accidentally since it has a really hard time recognizing just what card you're trying to select
column5: and once that selection is made getting out of it to select another card is also a pain. Three stars because the game is just so much fun for me I can get through it
column6: but man what a misstep of a port.

column3: The game base is really good (I play the game on console too)
column4: but the Android port is really bad. "Syncing data" to much time when you open the game (you cannot see the main menu until it finishes) The cards and buttons are too small. Changing the selected card of the hand it's troublesome. It's needed to aim at the enemy for an attack
column5: it will be better if you can permanently select an enemy that it will receive all your attacks. Sometimes the app freezes when you die.

column3: Never played the PC version but I enjoyed this game a lot on my switch. I've had no issues from what other reviews have said. It runs better on my phone than on the switch :(
5 stars for one of the best games I've ever played. This game created an entirely new genre (roguelike deckbuilders)
column4: and is incredibly balanced. The touch controls could certainly be better
column5: mostly in terms of how you select/deselect cards in your hand
column6: but otherwise its a really solid port. I have over 190 hours now in this Android version
column7: and even after all that playtime
column8: I'm still only at Ascension 11 or 12 (out of 20) for all of the characters. Strongly recommend this game.

column3: It's a really fun game
column4: I'd say the gameplay works even better for quick mobile sessions than on PC. One big problem though is that your progress is deleted sometimes when you save & quit. That kills all the fun
column5: especially if you had a good run and lose all your progress. With better saving options it would be 5 stars! Update: Downgrading my rating. It's just no fun when you had a great run and the game didn't save it. Also apparently Run History doesn't sync across devices.

column3: Fantastic game I've put many hours into on PC. This mobile port isn't great
column4: but it's not terrible. It isn't unoften that I play a wrong card or choose a wrong item from inaccurate controls. The game also sometimes forgets saved data
column5: erasing current runs. This is not a huge deal but worth mentioning: the loading time when you open the game (syncing data) takes a long time. Besides these things
column6: I am still happy to be able to play conveniently on the go. :)

column3: So as much as I'd love to give this a 5 star
column4: there is one large problem I and others run into. The problem is the sometimes wonky selection of cards
column5: and I use my phone's stylus BECAUSE I read the other reviews
column6: so it's not a "fat finger" issue. It's mostly happens when you select a card to use or read the description
column7: but it won't easily let you select a different card; It kind of "sticks" to the card you have selected. This often results in misplaying cards.

column3: If you've never played StS before it's a must buy - 5/5 game... but its an OK 'port'. While I have not had most of the issues mentioned in other reviews (slow loading
column4: crashes and corrupt save data). I have had some lag during death blows and the controls are sometimes janky. (I have had to turn down my sensitivity on android gestures because it kept doing that over card movements). Played on S21Ultra.

column3: Plays just like the desktop version and is still just as fun! Even better considering it can be while on the go! Why there's no 5/5: I have a Pixel 5 and the camera punchout is in the same location as the deck icon

column3: Awesome game. Easy to get into and lots to learn to get good along with great pacing. Really love the game and would love to dive deeper
column4: but unfortunately the controls are so bad that I can't recommend it. How prone you are to accidentally playing cards and making irreversible moves combined with roguelike mechanics is just game breaking. Half my runs come to a stop cause I misplay a card while trying to read what it does then I get annoyed and move on to something else.

column4: love the game
column5: don't like the bad port. The game just freezes after winning a run and every other tap triggers a data sync with accompanying annoying text. I haven't found a convenient way to put down a selected card since a two-finger tap doesn't do it and moving it back to the bottom is a 50/50 on whether it'll be played instead. Which is too bad
column6: because selecting the correct card is very inconvenient when your hand is full. Hope this'll be improved some day.

column3: So many hours in this game! Worth every penny
This game is clearly a 5/5
column4: and I've sunk hundreds of hours into it on PC and mobile
column5: but I have to dock a star for the Android port. It's just not a good port; it doesn't handle well
column6: there are several bugs and glitches that can easily frustrate you or cause you to play the wrong card
column7: and the "Syncing data" message is leading to absurdly long load times. It's still the best game on the Play Store.

column3: I absolutely adore this game. I've played a couple hundred hours on my computer
column4: and finally had to buy it for mobile so that I could play on the go. There is one slight issue
column5: though: when I switch to another app to do something else (check emails
column6: turn on Spotify
column7: etc.) it will occasionally totally forget the current run. There's no longer a continue prompt
column8: and the run isn't in the run history. I'm unsure if this is an issue with the game or my phone
column9: but it's the only issue I've experiened

column3: Sometime ascension won't update but when u restart it does so don't despair

column4: the game takes waay to long to load initially. Not too big of a deal
column5: it's like a minute for me. But what bothers me is that during this tine the game is supposedly synching and saving your gameplay...which is definitely NOT the case because I came back from taking a break playing a 50+ minute run and there was no option for me to continue it. THE GAME LOST MY RUN. WHAT WAS ALL OF THE SYNCHING AND SAVING OF PROGRESS FOR? Fixpls

column3: Fantastic game
column4: but garbage Android app. For fans considering getting the game to play on their phone
column5: I recommend using steamlink instead. Reasons the Android app sucks: (1) Insanely slow load. (2) Extreme battery usage. (3) Poor syncing issues--be prepared to lose entire runs. (4) Almost no UI changes. No
column6: I'm not kidding--it's the same game UI as designed for a large
column7: desktop screen just shrunk down on a phone. Trying to click the options menu without hitting deck or map is pretty freaking hard. Also
column8: in some scenarios
column9: like when you have a full hand
column10: you CAN"T target your left-most card when target-card-in-hand effects play (like choose a card to discard). So

column3: This game is the GOAT of card building games. The game itself is excellent. However
column4: the mobile version kinda sucks and here's why. - UI could be vastly improved
column5: by this I mean room for vertical layout
column6: bigger buttons
column7: confirmation when selecting once of cards (eg. Library). - Game crashes so so often. Examples include: I received a text My battery is low notification I plug in my phone to charge I get a call Ad Infiniti... - Crashes can wipe out your entire run - Syncing takes 25 secs avg

column3: Slay the Spire is one of my favorite games of all time. That said the port has some issues. These are the major ones. 1. The app 'losing' runs when you close midgame and randomly finding them again several games later 2. The app occasionally not recognizing when you beat an Ascension level. This has happened to me at least 3 times
column4: including my first time beating Asc 19
column5: which was very frustrating. 3. it is very difficult to deselect cards or potions if you decide you no longer wish to use them

column3: Love the game but the sync is awful. Hope this gets fixed. I have it on iOS and I hate to say it but iOS port runs like butter. This needs to be on par with iOS. I have this game on switch as well so I'm supporting the game. So please give us android users a smooth experience as well.Thanks for your work game developers.
Four stars because of one specific problem. I've had the game freeze upon winning multiple times
column4: usually after seeing your damage to the heart but before unlocks/breakdown of your score. It also just deletes your run. Normally you can just restart the game and continue where you left off but instead (since the run is "over") you lose an hour of time and don't get the win. This is not a rare crash. Small sample size but I'd say 1/4 wins will crash and not get credited. Pretty lame

column3: With any card game there is rng and luck involved. This one is no different. You can build a great deck from advancing just to get to the boss and be completely I'll equipped to deal with it. Some of the cards are just a complete waste to pick up and often you will do runs where you get to the boss and only have one additional card to your starting attacks and defense. That simply isn't powerful enough to defeat a boss or sometimes even an elite. Addicting though..

I love the game on PC and you definitely get the same joy on mobile but there are some frustrating issues with the app. Every time you start the app it needs to sync for an unreasonable amount of time. If it's just some save states it really can't be taking that long. First off I love the game itself. However
column4: I've run across several issues. Cloud sync does not work for me
column5: at least not between my Note 20 Ultra and my Tab S4. Makes the delays from "syncing" seem pointless. The other issue I've come across is after finishing a run snd closing the game it will start me back at the last fight. It counts them as 2 separate runs so you could end with 2 losses from the same run.

Great game nonstop playable action. However 2 things to note. 1. Had to re-download like 10 times to hopefully fix the saving issue during a run and 2. When picking which enemy to attack it is a huge hassle. So be very careful when picking your enemy the game just assumes some things some times. The golden rule however is never leave the game during a run otherwise you're basically guaranteed at least some lost progress when you return.

column3: Slay the spire is one of the greatest games of all time. It's such a perfect mobile game and I have hundreds of hours in it both on Android and on Switch. Easy to jump in
column4: addicting gameplay with a ton of replayability. These devs put so much love into the game. Only reason for 4 stars is 2 major issues: 1. It has some problems and delays when syncing data. Sometimes startup takes 15-20 seconds while it "syncs data" for example 2. Sometimes completing ascension doesn't unlock the next level.

column3: I truly love this game. I've played the desktop version for years so it saddens me to give such a low review but until the Ascension glitch is fixed I've stopped playing it. If you've not experienced it
column4: often times when you defeat an ascension rank the game will tell you that the next rank is unlocked but you won't be able to select it. Closing and reopening the game works most of the time but often you are just left to redo the run at the same rank. Not a 'feels good' moment

column4: great game. We all know slay the spire is great
column5: but this isn't a good port. It's the exact same UI as on PC and the touch controls really don't work that well with it. Prepare for TONS of mis-inputs. Be very careful scrolling thru cards if you need to make a selection as the scrolling often gets misinterpreted as a selection. Pretty frustrating that they didn't learn anything from the switch port. It had the exact same touch control issues.

column3: This game spawned a hundred clones. A testament to its quality. However
column4: I gave the phone port 4 stars. This is because it contains some interface problems. I've lost games due to occasional misclicks. The two main issues are; + Buttons are too small. + The card selection and targeting system is too imprecise. Also it has too many ways of selecting options. Fixes; + Remove the hand that shifts and use arrows either side instead. + Toggle drag and drop. + Clear place to deselect card.

column3: Game is having issues syncing game data. I've had to refinish multiple runs. I'll tap past the credits and then once I'm on the main menu it gives me the option to "continue" again which puts me back at the credits to finish the run. column3: If you like roguelikes or complex card games
column4: then this game is easily worth the price of admission. As for the quality of the mobile port

column6: these are pretty easy to get used to and the accessibility and portability make this version easily worth it if you simply want to play the game on your phone. Wpuld recommend.

column3: Fun game. Really good for plane rides
column4: but the length of a single battle fits into the typical time constraints mobile gaming is good for (coffee breaks
column5: waiting for the bus). Beating the game isn't too challenging
column6: but there's 20 levels of difficulty that you can unlock. This is nice because there's a lot of roguelikes where beating the game is a Herculean task; here beating the game at maximum difficulty is a real challenge but weaker players can still enjoy some satisfaction.

column3: I've put time into this game on PC and now mobile. I have Tha Note 20 Ultra so my phone is big enough that the cards aren't too small and I can use a stylus when selecting cards I think the only thing I can find wrong with the mobile version is that you can't view upgraded versions of cards before you buy them or when choosing them after a fight. If the devs were to add like a long click or something to allow that it would awesome. My favorite game on mobile. Buy it.

This is like a 4.5 star game with 1 star controls. Deselecting cards is too difficult. Potions as well. You'll accidentally select cards as rewards when you really are just trying to figure out what a keyword in it means. I don't have enough space to describe the tricks of getting around such flaws
column4: you'll just have to learn yourself and no doubt screw up numerous runs in the process Beyond that
column5: it's a lovely roguelike game with a great aesthetic and huge replayability.

I was skeptical on getting this with the negative reviews on controls but it feels like people are overly exaggerating. It does take awhile to sync which is annoying but the game plays pretty much like its PC counterpart. I've done maybe 9 runs and have only played the wrong card 2-3 times... I'd say any control issues would be from screen size and fat fingers anyways. Playing on S10+

column3: I had previously reviewed this game
column4: but decided it was still too complimentary. Do NOT buy this game. It is BROKEN. Forget the clumsy controls. Forget the extra long boot up time. You will completely lose hours upon hours of your life to this game
column5: not from playing it
column6: but from your game not loading properly. It happens CONSTANTLY. To not have any local backup is insanity. Slay the Spire is one of my favorite games ever but this version will frustrate you more than anything. DO NOT BUY.

column3: This is one of my all time favorite games and I am so happy to be able to play it on mobile. I only have one problem with this port and that's that the game crashes after completing a run pretty often making it impossible to progress. That doesn't make me not like it though I'm sure you guys will fix this soon. Thanks for the great game.

This is one of my all time favorite games and I am so happy to be able to play it on mobile. I only have one problem with this port and that's that the game crashes after completing a run pretty often making it impossible to progress. That doesn't make me not like it though I'm sure you guys will fix this soon. Thanks for the great game.
Pretty broken port. Good game tho
Pretty broken port. Good game tho

For being a 10$ app purchase it really fails to deliver on a mobile platform. The cards are difficult to choose and the game feels clunky to play. You can tell it was made for PC and converted as an after thought. It's not that slay the spire is a bad game. It's just a terrible mobile port and there are significantly better and more mobile apt rogue like deck builders in the market. Will update if changes are made

column3: I had high hopes for this game. I was doing my research on whether to buy it for the Switch on my phone. I decided to buy it for the phone. Much of what people said regarding the touch controls is partially true. It can be a bit difficult to use the touch controls
column4: but not much of a big deal. Very playable. The reason I'm rating it two stars is because literally after 48 minutes of gameplay it doesn't even let me load the game anymore. The cloud save isn't working. It gets stuck on the sync..

column3: Slay the spire is a brilliant game - well balanced
column4: addictive and replayable. The port however has significant issues. Run progress saves inconsistently and I've lost several autosave files in the sync at startup. The controls are a bit fiddly as well so it's easy to select incorrect cards at times
column5: which is a big problem in a roguelite. The support has also been lacking as these issues have existed since launch. A couple of fixes are needed to give this game the port it deserves.

Great game
column4: I have it on PC too and that version I'd easily give 5 stars. I can't do that with this version until the controls are fixed. I can't tell you how many times I've accidentally played the wrong card when trying to select a different one all because of the weird sticky controls. I don't know how they managed to make a card game difficult to control but I'll be darned if they didn't find a way. If/when that gets fixed I'll bump this up to five stars since it's still a phenomenal game.
